pr_title: Fix bug in circuit-breaker check for geoshape grid aggregations

timeline.message:
Fix bug in circuit-breaker check for geoshape grid aggregations

There was a bug in the geoshape circuit-breaker check where the
hash values array was being allocated before its new size was
accounted for by the circuit breaker.

Fixes #57847.
push the breaker up to SortingNumericDocValues

timeline.bodyText: l -> {} is good enough. But this is cool too.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Why not increment by the new size here and then decrement by the old size when we're done?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I guess I was trying to keep consistent with the old logic, but I can see how this iterative addition can also be somewhat obtuse in this new logic.
replies.author: talevy

timeline.bodyText: I think it'd be clearer to bail early if the newSize <= values.length rather than relying on the behavior of ArrayUtils.grow
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: I think it'd be clearer overside on our side and then call growExact. That way you end up with a precise value that you are growing to for tracking. And I don't have to go and read the source of grow, just oversize.
